hero.description:
Well-planned printed circuit boards (PCB) are a thing of beauty.
Functional, community-serving train networks? Even more so.
MetroM is an unholy amalgamation of the former with the latter conceived a couple of years ago in the mind of a serial procrastinator.

features.title: MetroM 2024 has a few new features:
features.description1: with options to hang on your wall or stand on your table

product_description.jr: This board maps out the sprawling JR lines across Tokyo and its neighbouring prefectures. This was the one that started it all two years ago on Kickstarter.
product_description.metro: A more focused look at Tokyo's fascinating subway system featuring the Tokyo Metro lines and essential JR Yamanote and Chuo-Sobu lines.
product_description.sg2030: I had to make a board in tribute to LTA’s ambitious 2030 MRT plan with the Cross Island & Jurong Region lines. This is the future of Singapore’s MRT, all mapped out.
product_description.sg2027: This (almost) credit card-sized PCB art is a cosy & space-friendly version of the Singapore MRT network that includes all confirmed lines up till 2027.
product_description.sf: The Bay Area’s transit is wonderfully chaotic with BART, VTA & Caltrain all doing their own thing. Three networks. One beautiful mess.
